t: Jeremiah 49
Prophecy against Ammon
Concerning*p the sons of Ammon. Thus says the Lord:*s “Does*pn Israel have no sons? Or*ln has he no heirs? Why*ln then has Malcam taken possession of Gad And*ln his people settled in its cities?

Therefore*ln behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “That*ln I will cause a trumpet blast of war to be heard Against*ln Rabbah of the sons of Ammon; And*ln it will become a desolate heap, And*ln her towns will be set on fire. Then*ln Israel will take possession of his possessors,” Says*ln the Lord.*s

“Wail,*ln O Heshbon, for Ai has been destroyed! Cry*ln out, O daughters of Rabbah, Gird*ln yourselves with sackcloth and lament, And*ln rush back and forth inside the walls; For*ln Malcam will go into exile Together*ln with his priests and his princes.
How*ln boastful you are about the valleys! Your*ln valley is flowing away,*i O*ln backsliding daughter Who*ln trusts in her treasures, saying,*i ‘Who*ln will come against me?’

Behold,*ln I am going to bring terror upon you,” Declares*ln the Lord God*s of hosts, “From*ln all directions*i around you; And*ln each of you will be driven out headlong, With*ln no one to gather the fugitives together.
But*ln afterward I will restore The*ln fortunes of the sons of Ammon,” Declares*ln the Lord.*s
Prophecy against Edom
Concerning*pn Edom. Thus*ln says the Lord*s of hosts, “Is*ln there no longer any wisdom in Teman? Has*ln good counsel been lost to the prudent? Has*ln their wisdom decayed?
Flee*ln away, turn back, dwell in the depths, O*ln inhabitants of Dedan, For*ln I will bring the disaster of Esau upon him At*ln the time I punish him.
If*ln grape gatherers came to you, Would*ln they not leave gleanings? If*ln thieves came*i by night, They*ln would destroy only*i until they had enough.

But*ln I have stripped Esau bare, I*ln have uncovered his hiding places So*ln that he will not be able to conceal himself; His*ln offspring has been destroyed along with his relatives And*ln his neighbors, and he is no more.
Leave*ln your orphans behind, I will keep them*i alive; And*ln let your widows trust in Me.”

For*p thus says the Lord,*s “Behold, those who were not sentenced to drink the cup will certainly drink it,*i and are you the one who will be completely acquitted? You will not be acquitted, but you will certainly drink it.*i
For I have sworn by Myself,” declares the Lord,*s “that Bozrah will become an object of horror, a reproach, a ruin and a curse; and all its cities will become perpetual ruins.”
I*pn have heard a message from the Lord,*s And*ln an envoy is sent among the nations, saying,*i “Gather*ln yourselves together and come against her, And*ln rise up for battle!”
“For*ln behold, I have made you small among the nations, Despised*ln among men.

As*ln for the terror of you, The*ln arrogance of your heart has deceived you, O*ln you who live in the clefts of the rock, Who*ln occupy the height of the hill. Though*ln you make your nest as high as an eagle’s, I*ln will bring you down from there,” declares the Lord.*s
“Edom*p will become an object of horror; everyone who passes by it will be horrified and will hiss at all its wounds.
Like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah with its neighbors,” says the Lord,*s “no one will live there, nor will a son of man reside in it.

Behold, one will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan against a perennially watered pasture; for in an instant I will make him run away from it, and whoever is chosen I shall appoint over it. For who is like Me, and who will summon Me into*i court?*i And who then is the shepherd who can stand against Me?”

Therefore*p hear the plan of the Lord*s which He has planned against Edom, and His purposes which He has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: surely they will drag them off, even*i the little ones of the flock; surely He will make their pasture desolate because of them.
The earth has quaked at the noise of their downfall. There is an outcry! The noise of it has been heard at the Red Sea.
Behold, He will mount up and swoop like an eagle and spread out His wings against Bozrah; and the hearts of the mighty men of Edom in that day will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
Prophecy against Damascus
Concerning*pn Damascus. “Hamath*ln and Arpad are put to shame, For*ln they have heard bad news; They*ln are disheartened. There*ln is anxiety by the sea, It*ln cannot be calmed.
Damascus*ln has become helpless; She*ln has turned away to flee, And*ln panic has gripped her; Distress*ln and pangs have taken hold of her Like*ln a woman in childbirth.
How*ln the city of praise has not been deserted, The*ln town of My joy!
Therefore,*ln her young men will fall in her streets, And*ln all the men of war will be silenced in that day,” declares the Lord*s of hosts.
“I*ln will set fire to the wall of Damascus, And*ln it will devour the fortified towers of Ben-hadad.”
Prophecy against Kedar and Hazor
Concerning*p Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated. Thus says the Lord,*s “Arise,*pn go up to Kedar And*ln devastate the men of the east.

They*ln will take away their tents and their flocks; They*ln will carry off for themselves Their*ln tent curtains, all their goods and their camels, And*ln they will call out to one another, ‘Terror on every side!’
Run*ln away, flee! Dwell in the depths, O*ln inhabitants of Hazor,” declares the Lord;*s “For*ln Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has formed a plan against you And*ln devised a scheme against you.
Arise,*ln go up against a nation which is at ease, Which*ln lives securely,” declares the Lord.*s “It*ln has no gates or bars; They*ln dwell alone.

Their*ln camels will become plunder, And*ln their many cattle for booty, And*ln I will scatter to all the winds those who cut the corners of*i their*i hair;*i And*ln I will bring their disaster from every side,” declares the Lord.*s
“Hazor*ln will become a haunt of jackals, A*ln desolation forever; No*ln one will live there, Nor*ln will a son of man reside in it.”
Prophecy against Elam
That*p which came as the word of the Lord*s to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying:
“Thus*pn says the Lord*s of hosts, ‘Behold,*ln I am going to break the bow of Elam, The*ln finest of their might.
I*ln will bring upon Elam the four winds From*ln the four ends of heaven, And*ln will scatter them to all these winds; And*ln there will be no nation To*ln which the outcasts of Elam will not go.

So*ln I will shatter Elam before their enemies And*ln before those who seek their lives; And*ln I will bring calamity upon them, Even*ln My fierce anger,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘And*ln I will send out the sword after them Until*ln I have consumed them.
Then*ln I will set My throne in Elam And*ln destroy out of it king and princes,’ Declares*ln the Lord.*s
‘But*ln it will come about in the last days That*ln I will restore the fortunes of Elam,’ ” Declares*ln the Lord.*s
